Probate.definition: the process of proving in a court of competent jurisdiction
Probate.origin: [Latin probatum , neuter of probatus , past participle of probare to test, approve, prove]

1 a.definition: the process of proving in a court of competent jurisdiction (as a probate court) that an instrument is the valid last will and testament of a deceased personthe process of administering an estate

sub_terms.b: the judicial determination that a will is valid

2.definition: the officially authenticated copy of a probated will

sub_terms.b: matters that fall under the jurisdiction of a probate courtvt

1.definition: to establish (a will) as valid through probate

2 a.definition: to put (a convicted offender) on probation
